ygData.messageBody:
This is to any low lvl paladin on the rathe server, I will pay 10 plat for
the first note that starts this quest. Being a High Elf, did not come to
freeport until about lvl 12. Also Sir would not work, because there are lady
Paladins too :P SO it would have to be either Sir or what ever would be the
proper termonology for a female paladin knight.

The Lady Laurana Highwind
Paladin of the 20th rank
Follower of Tunare
The Rathe
List Meidiator

P.S. Now that school is out I will be posting alot more

> From: Vey Takon <veytakon@...>
>
> This is a post I made to some of the other message boards and mailing
lists.
> I hope it helps.
>
> Your best bet if you can't start the quest is to ask a lower level Paladin
> (under 9th) to get you the first note.
> ____________________
>
> A call to arms for all Paladins!
>
> This message is for all Paladins of the Knights of Truth in Freeport. This
is
> a Quest update, and a call for support as well.
>
> The Test of Truth, a quest given by a Paladin behind the Hall of Truth, is
> billed as one of the
> most important quests in the game for a Paladin of that guild. This test,
> however is rarely even
> started on my server (Cazic-Thule) and on many others from the people I
have
> talked with. The
> reason is the reward for the quest is not very well defined. First let me
give
> you some basic
> information on the quest.
>
> What you join the Knights of Truth Paladin guild in Freeport you are
> welcomed warmly, but you are made well aware that you are NOT a Knight
yet.
> You start as a squire, and upon asking the Knights you will find that
there is
> one, and only one way to become a true Knight. And that is to complete the
> Test of Truth. I won't spoil the entire quest, but it starts by bringing a
> letter to Altunic Jartin, the roaming shield salesman in East Commonlands.
The
> quest is in two parts. At the completion of each part you receive a Token.
> When you have both tokens you return them to the Knight who gave you the
quest
> and this starts the actual Test of Truth. All of this information is given
to
> you vaguely when you first ask about the quest.
>
> Please note that you cannot start this quest after 8th level!
> Also, the quest is NOT BROKEN (it was fixed very soon after the release of
the
> game) but finding Altunic Jartin can be difficult as he moves around the
zone.
>
> Upon completion of the Test of Truth you are welcomed as a Knight and
> given a note to prove it. This is where I need the assistance of all
Paladins
> in the Realm.
>
> Now that I (Vawhn on Cazic-Thule) have completed the quest and have
> become a Knight, I
> would expect to have a title to show it. I mean, I am a Knight, what else
> (other than a holy sword and a trusty steed) could a Paladin ever want.
But I
> did not get a title. In fact, other than the note, which I keep safely
locked
> away in the bank, I have no proof that I am a Knight at all.
>
> I have talked to a GM about this, and suggested that a Sir be added
to
> the beginning of my
> name, or that be added to the end of my name (I preferred the Sir, and
made
> that fact clear) and the GM really liked the idea. He said he would bring
it
> up at their next meeting, and asked me to write a feedback detailing my
> opinion and justification, which I did.
>
> I ask all of you to do the same, if you support my suggestion of
course.
> My justification was
> simple (although I welcome any differing opinions, as I am sure the GMs
> would). I have two
> reasons for this request. First, I play a Paladin because I am playing a
RPG,
> and I like to play the character (as much if not more than to have the
> abilities). For my character, what better way to show that I am eternally
> dedicated to my code than to have my title displayed in my name for all to
> see. The second reasoning is that (according to the game itself) 50% of
> Everquest is the questing, and I found this quest a little, ok VERY
> disappointing. If a quest existed that could make such a permanent and
> profound change to a young Paladin, it would improve the questing at least
in
> Freeport (which for those of you who don't take the quests, there is a
very
> good story going on there).
>
> Again, if you support this idea, please send a feedback (In Game)
with
> your ideas and opinions. The seed has already been planted, and Everquest
> DOES LISTEN. I know this from personal experience. They just need to hear
> about it from others, and hear about it often.
>
> No you just need your Trusty Steed and your Holy Sword. Good luck on
the
> horse.
>
> --
> -Sir Vawhn, Knight of Truth, Silver
> Cazic-Thule server
>
